alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 5:16PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: .Warmer temperatures have accelerated snowmelt across the area leading to water and debris that have flow across area roadways. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following county, Elko. * WHEN...Until 500 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 516 PM PDT, Nevada Department of Transportation reported flooding in SR-226 near MM 15. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in SR-226 near MM 15. - SR-226 near MM 15 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Elko County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
